description: You underwent a craniotomy, which is a procedure where a temporary window is made in the skull to access and remove your tumor, with the opening being repaired at the end of the surgery.

events.description: You arrived at the operating room to begin your procedure
You were given 11.25 mg of Midazolam as an induction dose, and 1.5 mg per hour to keep you asleep.
An MRI image was taken of the right lateral hemisphere
A lesion was located and annotated by that radiology team
Your surgical has begun closing the wound where they entered
Your surgical procedure is now complete
Anaesthesia drugs have stopped being administered
You we're transferred to the post anesthesia care unit
